i5.las2peer.services.gamificationApplicationService.helper

Class RepositoryHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.services.gamificationApplicationService.helper.RepositoryHelper

  • public abstract class RepositoryHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class providing means to create local repositories, add files to them and push them to a remote GitHub repository. Does not provide means to commit files (please do manually).

    • Method Detail

      • generateNewRepository

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository generateNewRepository(java.lang.String name,
                                                                    java.lang.String gitHubOrganization,
                                                                    java.lang.String gitHubUser,
                                                                    java.lang.String gitHubPassword)
                                                             throws GitHubException
        Generates a new (local) repository to add files to. Also creates a (remote) GitHub repository with the same name and adds it to the (local) repository's configuration to be later used as its remote entry to push to.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the repository to be created
        gitHubOrganization - the organization that is used in the CAE
        gitHubUser - the CAE user
        gitHubPassword - the password of the CAE user
        Returns:
        a Repository
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during this creation process

      • getTemplateRepositoryContent

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.treewalk.TreeWalk getTemplateRepositoryContent(java.lang.String templateRepositoryName,
                                                                              java.lang.String gitHubOrganization)
                                                                       throws GitHubException
        Clones the template repository from GitHub to the local machine and returns a TreeWalk that can be used to retrieve the repository's content. Repository is used "read-only" here.
        Parameters:
        templateRepositoryName - the name of the template repository
        gitHubOrganization - the organization that is used in the CAE
        Returns:
        a TreeWalk
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during retrieving the repository's content

      • getRepositoryContent

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.treewalk.TreeWalk getRepositoryContent(java.lang.String repositoryName,
                                                                      java.lang.String gitHubOrganization)
                                                               throws GitHubException
        Clones a repository from GitHub to the local machine and returns a TreeWalk that can be used to retrieve the repository's content. Repository is used "read-only" here.
        Parameters:
        repositoryName - the name of the template repository
        gitHubOrganization - the organization that is used in the CAE
        Returns:
        a TreeWalk
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during retrieving the repository's content

        Clones a repository from GitHub to the local machine and returns it.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • createTextFileInRepository

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository createTextFileInRepository(org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository repository,
                                                                         java.lang.String relativePath,
                                                                         java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                         java.lang.String content)
                                                                  throws GitHubException
        Adds a text (source code-)file to the repository. Beware of side effects, due to adding all files in main folder to staged area currently.
        Parameters:
        repository - the repository the file should be added to
        relativePath - the relative path the file should reside at; without first separator
        fileName - the file name
        content - the content the file should have
        Returns:
        the Repository, now containing one more file
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during the creation of the file

      • createBinaryFileInRepository

                                                                           java.lang.Object content)
                                                                    throws GitHubException
        Adds a binary file to the repository. Beware of side effects, due to adding all files in main folder to staged area currently.
        Parameters:
        repository - the repository the file should be added to
        relativePath - the relative path the file should reside at; without first separator
        fileName - the file name
        content - the content the file should have
        Returns:
        the Repository, now containing one more file
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during the creation of the file

      • createImageFileInRepository

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository createImageFileInRepository(org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository repository,
                                                                          java.lang.String relativePath,
                                                                          java.lang.String fileName,
                                                                          java.awt.image.BufferedImage content)
                                                                   throws GitHubException
        Adds an image file to the repository. Beware of side effects, due to adding all files in main folder to staged area currently.
        Parameters:
        repository - the repository the file should be added to
        relativePath - the relative path the file should reside at; without first separator
        fileName - the file name
        content - the content the image should have
        Returns:
        the Repository, now containing one more file
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during the creation of the file

      • pushToRemoteRepository

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository pushToRemoteRepository(org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository repository,
                                                                     java.lang.String gitHubUser,
                                                                     java.lang.String gitHubPassword)
                                                              throws GitHubException
        Pushes a local repository (from and) to the "master" branch on GitHub. This method only works with repositories previously created by generateNewRepository(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        repository - the Repository to be pushed to GitHub
        gitHubUser - the CAE user
        gitHubPassword - the password of the CAE user
        Returns:
        the Repository that was pushed
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during the push command

      • pushToRemoteRepository

        public static org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository pushToRemoteRepository(org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository repository,
                                                                     java.lang.String gitHubUser,
                                                                     java.lang.String gitHubPassword,
                                                                     java.lang.String localBranchName,
                                                                     java.lang.String remoteBranchName)
                                                              throws GitHubException
        Pushes a local repository to GitHub. This method only works with repositories previously created by generateNewRepository(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        repository - the Repository to be pushed to GitHub
        gitHubUser - the CAE user
        gitHubPassword - the password of the CAE user
        localBranchName - the name of the branch that should be pushed from
        remoteBranchName - the name of the branch that should be pushed to
        Returns:
        the Repository that was pushed
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if anything goes wrong during the push command

      • deleteRemoteRepository

        public static void deleteRemoteRepository(java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String gitHubOrganization,
                                          java.lang.String gitHubUser,
                                          java.lang.String gitHubPassword)
                                   throws GitHubException
        Deletes a repository on GitHub, given by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the repository
        gitHubOrganization - the name of the repositories organization
        gitHubUser - the name of the GitHub user
        gitHubPassword - the password of the GitHub user
        Throws:
        GitHubException - if deletion was not successful
